text: Current Major League Baseball team owners and the principal corporate entities that operate the clubs: ==List== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" border="1" |- !scope="col"|Team !scope="col"|Principal owner(s) !scope="col"|Operating entities !scope="col"|Purchase price !scope="col"|Year |- |Arizona Diamondbacks !scope="row"| |AZPB LP, AZPBI Inc. |$130,000,000 |1995 |- |Atlanta Braves !scope="row"| Liberty Media |Atlanta National League Baseball Club Inc. |$450,000,000 |2007 |- |Baltimore Orioles !scope="row"|Peter Angelos |Baltimore Orioles LP, Baltimore Orioles Inc., Baltimore Baseball Club Inc. |$173,000,000 |1993 |- |Boston Red Sox !scope="row"| |Boston Red Sox Baseball Club LP, Fenway Sports Group LLC |$660,000,000 |2002 |- |Chicago Cubs !scope="row"| |Chicago National League Ball Club Inc. |$845,000,000 |2009 |- |Chicago White Sox !scope="row"| |Chicago White Sox Ltd., Chisox Corp. |$20,000,000 |1981 |- |Cincinnati Reds !scope="row"| |Cincinnati Reds LLC |$270,000,000 |2006 |- |Cleveland Indians !scope="row"| |Cleveland Indians Baseball Co. LP |$323,000,000 |1999 |- |Colorado Rockies !scope="row"| |Colorado Baseball Partnership, Colorado Rockies Baseball Club Ltd. |$95,000,000 |1992 |- |Detroit Tigers !scope="row"| |Olympia Entertainment, Detroit Tigers Inc. |$82,000,000 |1992 |- |Houston Astros !scope="row"| |Crane Capital Group, Houston Astros Inc., Houston Astros, LLC |$615,000,000 |2011 |- |Kansas City Royals !scope="row"|John Sherman |Kansas City Royals Baseball Corp. |$1,000,000,000 |2020 |- |Los Angeles Angels !scope="row"| |Angels Baseball LP, Moreno Baseball LP |$184,000,000 |2003 |- |Los Angeles Dodgers !scope="row"| |Guggenheim Baseball Management, Los Angeles Dodgers, Inc. |$2,000,000,000 |2012 |- |Miami Marlins !scope="row"| |Miami Marlins LP, Miami Marlins Inc., Miami Marlins Baseball Ltd. |$1,300,000,000 |2018 |- |Milwaukee Brewers !scope="row"| |Milwaukee Brewers Baseball Club, Milwaukee Brewers Holdings LLC |$223,000,000 |2005 |- |Minnesota Twins !scope="row"| |Minnesota Twins, MTI Partnership LLP |$44,000,000 |1984 |- |New York Mets !scope="row"| |Sterling Doubleday Enterprises LC, Mets Partners Inc. |$391,000,000 |2002 |- |New York Yankees !scope="row"| |Yankee Global Enterprises |$8,700,000 |1973 |- |Oakland Athletics !scope="row"| |Oakland Athletics Limited Partnership https://businesssearch.sos.ca.gov/CBS/SearchResults?SearchType=LPLLC&SearchCriteria;=oakland+athletics&SearchSubType;=Keyword |$180,000,000 |2005 |- |Philadelphia Phillies !scope="row"| |The Phillies |$30,000,000 |1981 |- |Pittsburgh Pirates !scope="row"| |Pittsburgh Associates LP, Pittsburgh Baseball Inc. |$92,000,000 |1996 |- |San Diego Padres !scope="row"| |The Padres Group, Padres LP, Padres Inc. |$800,000,000 |2012 |- |San Francisco Giants !scope="row"| |San Francisco Baseball Associates LP, SF Giants Baseball Club |$100,000,000 |1992 |- |Seattle Mariners !scope="row"| John W. Stanton |Baseball Club of Seattle LP, Baseball of Seattle Inc. |$106,000,000 |1992 |- |St. Louis Cardinals !scope="row"| |St. Louis Cardinals LLC, St. Louis National Baseball Club Inc. |$150,000,000 |1995 |- |Tampa Bay Rays !scope="row"| |Tampa Bay Rays Ltd. |$130,000,000 |2005 |- |Texas Rangers !scope="row"| |Rangers Baseball Express, Texas Rangers Baseball Club |$593,000,000 |2010 |- |Toronto Blue Jays !scope="row"| Rogers Communications |Rogers Blue Jays Baseball Partnership, Toronto Blue Jays Baseball Ltd |$140,000,000 |2000 |- |Washington Nationals !scope="row"| |Washington Nationals Baseball Club LLC |$450,000,000 |2006 |} ===Notes=== #The Atlanta Braves sale in 2007 to Liberty Media was part of a complex swap of cash, stock, magazine holdings, and the Braves, in which Time Warner sent the Braves, a hobbyist publishing company, and $980,000,000 to Liberty in exchange for approximately 68.5 million shares of Time Warner stock, at the time worth $1.48 billion. It was announced and confirmed that the Braves were given a value of $450,000,000 in the transaction. #The price for the St. Louis Cardinals included Busch Stadium. #As much as $200,000,000 of the sale price included the team's 20-percent stake in Fox Sports San Diego. ==See also== *List of professional sports team owners *List of current Major League Baseball general managers ==References== ==External links== *2008 Forbes MLB Team Valuations * Major League Baseball principal owners *
title: List of Major League Baseball principal owners
